Participants.evidence: distal segments of radial arteries obtained by no-touch technique from coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) patients (n=10)

Intervention.evidence: compare the efficacy of two different papaverine concentrations (0.5 mg/ml and 2 mg/ml)

Objective.evidence: The aim of this study was to compare the efficacy of two different papaverine concentrations (0.5 mg/ml and 2 mg/ml) for vasospasm prevention and their impact on endothelium integrity.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The vasodilatory effect of papaverine (concentrations of 0.5 mg/ml and 2 mg/ml) was assessed in vitro

Result_Outcome.evidence: 2 mg/ml papaverine concentration showed stronger vasodilatatory effect than 0.5 mg/ml, but it caused significantly higher endothelial damage.

Harms.evidence: it caused significantly higher endothelial damage
